<FI>A Psalm<Fi> of David. The LORD <FI>is<Fi> my light and my salvation; whom shall I fear? the LORD <FI>is<Fi> the strength of my life; of whom shall I be afraid?
When the wicked, <FI>even<Fi> mine enemies and my foes, came upon me to eat up my flesh, they stumbled and fell.<RF>came…: Heb. approached against me<Rf>
Though an host should encamp against me, my heart shall not fear: though war should rise against me, in this <FI>will<Fi> I <FI>be<Fi> confident.

One <FI>thing<Fi> have I desired of the LORD, that will I seek after; that I may dwell in the house of the LORD all the days of my life, to behold the beauty of the LORD, and to enquire in his temple.<RF>the beauty: or, the delight<Rf>
For in the time of trouble he shall hide me in his pavilion: in the secret of his tabernacle shall he hide me; he shall set me up upon a rock.

And now shall mine head be lifted up above mine enemies round about me: therefore will I offer in his tabernacle sacrifices of joy; I will sing, yea, I will sing praises unto the LORD.<RF>joy: Heb. shouting<Rf><CM>
Hear, O LORD, <FI>when<Fi> I cry with my voice: have mercy also upon me, and answer me.
<FI>When thou saidst<Fi>, Seek ye my face; my heart said unto thee, Thy face, LORD, will I seek.<RF>When…: or, My heart said unto thee, Let my face seek thy face, etc<Rf>
Hide not thy face <FI>far<Fi> from me; put not thy servant away in anger: thou hast been my help; leave me not, neither forsake me, O God of my salvation.
When my father and my mother forsake me, then the LORD will take me up.<RF>take…: Heb. gather me<Rf>
Teach me thy way, O LORD, and lead me in a plain path, because of mine enemies.<RF>a plain…: Heb. a way of plainness<Rf><RF>mine…: Heb. those which observe me<Rf>
Deliver me not over unto the will of mine enemies: for false witnesses are risen up against me, and such as breathe out cruelty.
<FI>I had fainted<Fi>, unless I had believed to see the goodness of the LORD in the land of the living.
Wait on the LORD: be of good courage, and he shall strengthen thine heart: wait, I say, on the LORD.<CM>
